# References {.unnumbered}

## Key Papers

Essential research on color use, perception, and data visualization:

- @crameri2020misuse - The misuse of color in science communication
- @borkin2011evaluation - Evaluation of visualization effectiveness
- @golebiowska2022rainbow - Problems with rainbow color schemes
- @heron2021rainbow - Rainbow colormaps and their issues

## Books

- @wilke2019fundamentals - [Fundamentals of Data Visualization](https://clauswilke.com/dataviz) - Comprehensive guide to visualization principles (free online)
- **[R Graphics Cookbook](https://r-graphics.org)** by Winston Chang - Practical recipes for ggplot2 (free online)


## Color Resources

### Tools

- **[ColorBrewer](https://colorbrewer2.org)** - Interactive tool for selecting color palettes for maps and data visualization
- **[Coblis](https://www.coblis.com)** - Color Blindness Simulator - Upload images to see how they appear with different types of color vision deficiency

### R Packages

- **viridis** - Perceptually uniform color scales - https://cran.r-project.org/package=viridis
- **RColorBrewer** - ColorBrewer palettes for R
- **colorspace** - Color manipulation and assessment
- **dichromat** - Simulate color blindness
- **paletteer** - Collection of 2000+ palettes

## Documentation

- **[ggplot2 Reference](https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/reference/)** - Complete function reference
- **[plotly for R](https://plotly.com/r/)** - Interactive plotting library
